==Japanese==
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|支那}}
{{wikipedia|Shina (word)}}
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|し|な}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しな}} {{m|zh|支那|tr=tsye na}}, a phonetic transcription of {{der|ja|sa|चीन|sort=しな}}, itself likely deriving from {{etyl|och|ja|sort=しな}} {{m|zh|秦|tr=*dzin}}, the name of the {{w|Qin Dynasty}} and the {{w|Qin (state)|Qin state}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|しな}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|ja|シナ}}

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|しな|シナ}}

# [[China]] {{qualifier|prewar; often considered derogatory in modern speech}}

====Usage notes====
The kanji spelling {{m|ja|支那}} was more common historically, and is still encountered with some frequency when this word is used.  Modern usage includes {{m|ja|シナ}} in katakana.  However, this term as a whole is used less frequently than in the past, due in part to changes in geopolitics.

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|東支那海|^ひがし ^しな ^かい}}: East China Sea
* {{ja-r|支那蕎麦|^しな そば}}: Chinese noodles, [[ramen]]
* {{ja-r|支那竹|^しな ちく}}: [[menma]] (cooked bamboo sprout, a kind of ramen topping)
{{der-bottom}}
